answers.answer: Some can control it with diet and exercise, but others (like myself) end up insulin dependent. I know people who have had it and only had 6-7lb babies which is average. Mine on the other hand were 8lbs 6oz (the first, but I didn't take insulin with that pregnancy and I passed on gluc test and failed one so they let me slip under the radar). With the second I wasn't so lucky I had to take insulin and she was 8lbs 9ozs and 2wks early! I know a girl who had a 10lb 4oz baby boy. Anywho, what I'm saying is everone is different. Also since I was on insulin my dr. says that there are some test that can be done to detect it early( I'm 8wks 5days) so, maybe I can avoid it this time.GOOD LUCK to you!

question: I am 22w 1d now.  For the past week I have been having dizzy spells where I feel week.  I have had these in past when my sugar gets to low and I haven't eaten, but when it has happend lately, it is after I have ate and I am full.  I have also had very dry mouth for the past few days where I feel like I have to drink all the time but the dry mouth does not get better.  I have heard this is a sign of gestational diabetes.  I have a appt. today and I will mention it to my dr. but he told me I would have a glucose tolerence test between 24 and 26 weeks, but will they do it sooner if I am having these symptoms?  How do you control it if you do have it and what size were your babies?  Thanks for the help.
title: gestational diabeties? (Open Fourm)
